category.name: Family Prayers
category.description: Prayers for family devotion and spiritual growth

content.text:
Hey, listen to your heart for a second.

Remember, it's not just something you should do, but something you get to do: find your joy in God.
He actually wants that for you, especially with all the grace He gives.
So, find your joy in the One who gives so much good.
Be happy in Him, and only Him,
because whatever you put your trust in
is where you expect to find your happiness.
The one who is the foundation of your faith
should also be the source of your joy.
So why do you feel so down and heavy,
when joy has been planted inside youâ€”
promised by the Father,
given by the Son,
and worked into you by the Holy Spirit?
It's yours because of grace,
it's part of who you are now that you believe.
Are you trying to find joy in yourself,
out of pride or wanting to look good?
You don't have anything on your own but your mess-ups,
nothing that makes God give you His grace,
or keep it coming.
If you forget that, you'll lose your joy.
Are you feeling bad about the sin that still hangs around inside?
Let that healthy kind of sadness lead you to change,
because that's the attitude God blesses,
and it actually leads to the greatest joy.
Being sorry for your own stuff opens you up to find joy in God.
Letting go of self-obsession brings down God's amazing peace.
Have you been looking for joy in other things or people?
Don't look for happiness in anything less than God.
Don't get too comfortable with things that will only let you down.
Let God be your everything,
and find your joy in the source that never runs dry.
